channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.description:

  • Description: THIS PACKAGE CAME OVER THE IRREG BELT DURING THE SORT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024060049
item.description:
Report E-2024060049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: FOUNTAIN
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DYNO NOBEL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 400300
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The CTMV was travelling northeast on NC 222. The truck drove off the right side of the roadway, overcorrected, and then skidded across the center line and overturned onto its side. The CTMV rolled onto the passenger side of the vehicle across NC 222. During the rollover the force of impact caused the manway failure. Approximately 2,000 lbs. of emulsion spilled from the tank onto the ground. A hazardous materials contractor recovered the spilled emulsion and remediated the soil. The cost for the cleanup and remediation is still pending final notification from the contractor.

item.title: Report I-2024040080
item.description:
Report I-2024040080

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-13T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the top side of the pail putting a 1/2 inch long puncture in the drum. Pail was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE DRIVER DISCOVERED A LEAKING PACKAGE IN HIS PACKAGE CAR. A CLASS 8 CORROSIVE LABEL WAS VISIBLE. UN 1823 SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLID WAS ALSO VISIBLE. THE DRIVER CONTACTED AND RETURNED TO THE CENTER SO THE DAMAGED PACKAGE COULD BE PROCESSED.

  • Description: Package was found on the dock with wet external packaging. Upon investigation it was found that one of the four glass bottles had shattered, causing internal leakage. Package was placed into a hazmat bag, and then into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024051724
item.description:
Report X-2024051724

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No spill found for cleanup. One of four bottles of liquid had a loose cap causing internal leakage. No internal packaging found;however, one piece of cardboard was placed between lids and outer packaging. Lid failed due to not being completely closed.
